title: snowpega
author: snowpega
content: hi there!hope y'll doing fine today. Coinbase has obtain a major payment institution (MPI) license from Monetary Authority of Singapore (MPS), the firm announced on 1st october. Actually, coinbase is united state based cryptocurrency exchange which is also now approved in singapore from the central bank of country. image source Their main target to increase the digital payment token services using Bitcoin and alt tokens . Coinbase has also integrated Singapore digital services like Singpass, to simplifying onboarding. Moreover coinbase is also collaborating with major local blockchain firms, which includes nansen.ai, blockdaemon and infura to target its product like base blockchain and wallet-as-a-service.News source

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on October 03, 2023, 12:06:01 AMMakes me wonder what requirement is required for these companies to obtain a license in Singapore. There are several requirements that must be met by cryptocurrency exchange companies that wish to obtain a license and operate in Singapore including.- Create a system to control the risks associated with cryptocurrency exchange;- Follow transparent and legal trading rules;- Providing sufficient resources for work - financial, technical, human;- Protecting the confidentiality of customer information and the security of funds on the platform;- Have the ability to record every transaction;- Establish a board of directors and committees for payments, audits, appointments, and conflict resolution;- Meet AML/CFT criteria and other international standards.Quote from: joniboini on October 03, 2023, 12:06:01 AMA quick search shows that the business needs to have some capital and one Singaporean citizen involved in the company. It doesn't look like you need to have an office there. If that is the case, the difference is not that big to other SEA countries afaik. The key difference is definitely the infrastructure and access to the market.Requiring a certain amount of capital and one or more local residents involved in the company is true and a condition that must be met. But as for whether or not it is necessary to have an office, it is very necessary and also an important requirement to establish an office in the jurisdiction.Source: https://prifinance.com/en/cryptocurrency-license/singaporeCoinbase also has an office or building a company in Singapore and you can check the address in the link below.https://www.coinbase.com/legal/user_agreement/singapore

comments.author: Text
comments.body: I agree that this news could have a positive impact on other countries. As more and more countries see the benefits of regulating and supporting the cryptocurrency industry, they are likely to follow suit. This could lead to a significant increase in mass adoption of cryptocurrency in the coming years. I'm also impressed by Coinbase's commitment to working with local regulators and blockchain firms. This shows that the company is serious about building a long-term presence in Singapore, and it is likely to attract more users and clients to the platform. I think this is a very positive development for the cryptocurrency industry in Singapore and around the world. I'm excited to see what the future holds for Coinbase and the rest of the industry. I'm particularly interested to see how Coinbase's collaboration with local blockchain firms will play out. I think this could lead to some innovative new products and services for users in Singapore and beyond. I'm also curious to see how this development impacts the cryptocurrency industry in Singapore more broadly. Will it attract other major exchanges to the country? Will it encourage more businesses to start accepting cryptocurrency payments? I'm excited to see what the future holds!
